results.title: An Introduction to Aussie sports
results.creator_credit: Australian Sports Commission and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: Max Walker, ex-Australian cricketer, introduces an educational program designed to encourage greater on-going participation in sports by children. Outlines modified team games such as Softcrosse, modified hockey, mini-soccer and T-Ball. Describes the awards scheme for four Aussie Sports and makes reference to the resource manual accompanying the sports.

results.title: An Interview with Susan George
results.creator_credit: Mary Leggett, Freedom From Hunger and Mark Stiles
results.brief_description: Susan George, food economist and author of “How the other half dies” talks about food distribution in the world, reasons for starvation amongst third world peoples and the influence of the western world upon third world hunger problems.

results.title: An Interactive discovery tour of Victoria (PC)
results.brief_description: This program is produced under the auspices of Tourism Victoria and follows the campaign “You’ll love every piece of Victoria’. The main wonders of the State are presented in seven segments: Melbourne, Food and Wine, Shopping, Major Events, Arts and Culture, Regional Victoria, Location and Access. Aimed primarily at a foreign audience, the program is filled with maps, touring suggestions and good addresses as well as video interviews with Victorian identities. It is presented in 3 versions: Designed for PCs, this CD-ROM requires Windows 3.1 or above.

results.title: An Inquiry into the growth of American cities
results.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Altered Environment Series”.
American cities have grown outwards, due to the appearance of unlimited land resources. Now questions are being asked about the environmental destruction resulting from urban sprawl. This film involves students in an analysis of the factors that must be considered in the design of cities

results.title: An Industrial lake port
results.creator_credit: Victor Vicas and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
The film opens in a lighthouse on the Great Lakes where a sailor from the United States Coast Guard is entertaining a grup of visiting Sea Scouts on a tour of the region. Discusses the various industries that take place on the Great Lakes and how in winter when the lakes freeze over, the crews on the cargo ships must work on ocean-going vessels for part of the year when the lakes are not navigable.

results.title: An Impression of London
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures and William Pollard
results.brief_description: The round-the-clock activities of a typical London day described by a young American girl in her diary. Arriving by air at dawn, she explores London - the Tower of London, a search for the site of Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, feeding the pigeons in Trafalgar Square, a glimpse of the procession of the Household Cavalry at Hyde Park Corner, the streets, shops and parks, a visit to a riverside pub at dusk, dinner at a West End restaurant and a midnight cabaret.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures and William Pollard

results.title: An Illustration of basic film editing principles
results.brief_description: Leon Barsha of the American Cinema Editors has taken a sequence from the motion picture “Baby Face Nelson” to illustrate film editing techniques. Actors Mickey Rooney, Sir Cedric Hardwicke and Carolyn Jones are shown from our angle as on a stage. Then Leon Barsha shows how the same scene was heightened in mood and drama by editing with use of inserts - two shots, close-ups and extreme close-ups.

results.title: An Hour from London
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”
Depicts the great variety of scenery and historical landmarks near to London. By road one can go to East Anglia; by rail to Brighton; by boat to Henley, Oxford, Windsor Castle and Hampton Court. Down the Thames at Greenwich are mementos of Lord Nelson and Samuel Pepys.

results.title: An Eye for the job
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sim, Nigel Miller and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
A documentary about the quiet revolution in the operating theatre. The surgeon has now harnessed his skills to the microscope, and operations of the most minute detail are achieved with microsurgery. Depicts five case studies - a blind painter is made to see again, a deaf grandmother can hear again, a worker’s torn off hand is restored, a man’s severed thumb is replaced by his big toe, and a young woman has her fallopian tubes untied.

results.brief_description: Shows how ideas and design are converted into computer language and how the “light pen” has enabled the engineer or designer to communicate with a computer in his own terms-pictorially-by the technique of computer graphics.
